page.title: 11DAIRY FARMER'S DIARY
page.content:
In summer Edward Roper, Church Farm, Northwick, rises at 7 am milks fresian cows 6 at a time by suction machine. A milk tanker collects while he has breakfast. Then he scrapes muck from yard, cuts grass for hay. After lunch baling, baler picks up grass and makes cuboid bales. After tea he collects bales by tractor with hydraulic loader or makes silage for winter feed. He must understand cows and know about machinery necessary to run a modern farm efficiently and economically _ like tractor attachements, combine harvester, muck spreader, baler, forage harvester, milking parlour etc.
Andrew Roper
